definition: in actual fact
example: to be nominally but not actually independent

definition: consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning

definition: evaluate or estimate the nature, quality, ability, extent, or significance of

definition: free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth
example: the correct answer

definition: the act of offering an improvement to replace a mistake; setting right
example: market runups are invariably followed by a correction

definition: establish after a calculation, investigation, experiment, survey, or study
example: find the product of two numbers

example: I will have the family jewels appraised by a professional

definition: your basis for belief or disbelief; knowledge on which to base belief
example: the evidence that smoking causes lung cancer is very compelling

definition: consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning
example: analyze a sonnet by Shakespeare

definition: to travel for the purpose of discovery
example: he called for a careful exploration of the consequences

definition: a piece of information about circumstances that exist or events that have occurred
example: first you must collect all the facts of the case

definition: a message received and understood
example: statistical data

definition: look over carefully
example: Please inspect your father's will carefully

definition: investigate scientifically
example: Let's investigate the syntax of Chinese

definition: (used in combination or as a suffix) able to withstand
example: temptation-proof

definition: be shown or be found to be
example: She proved to be right

definition: an instance of questioning
example: there was a question about my training

definition: an examination consisting of a few short questions
example: We got quizzed on French irregular verbs

definition: being or occurring in fact or actuality; having verified existence; not illusory
example: real objects

definition: all of your experiences that determine how things appear to you
example: his world was shattered

definition: determine the length of
example: rectify a curve

definition: systematic investigation to establish facts
example: He searched for information on his relatives on the web

definition: the act of rewriting something
example: We must retool the town's economy

definition: a small part of something intended as representative of the whole
example: Sample the regional dishes

definition: a particular branch of scientific knowledge
example: the science of genetics

definition: to look at critically or searchingly, or in minute detail
example: he scrutinized his likeness in the mirror

definition: the activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone
example: Scientists are exploring the nature of consciousness

definition: specify as a condition or requirement in a contract or agreement; make an express demand or provision in an agreement
example: The will stipulates that she can live in the house for the rest of her life

definition: watch and direct
example: Who is overseeing this project?

definition: trying something to find out about it
example: a sample for ten days free trial

definition: a just detectable amount
example: he speaks French with a trace of an accent

definition: a line or route along which something travels or moves
example: the hurricane demolished houses in its path

definition: the act of testing something
example: in the experimental trials the amount of carbon was measured separately

definition: a fact that has been verified
example: at last he knew the truth

definition: declare or make legally valid
example: validate a ticket

definition: confirm the truth of
example: Please verify that the doors are closed

definition: discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of by perception with the eyes
example: She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water
